items.sentence: I think you ought to let Tom go to Boston by himself.
I thought you said you wanted to do that by yourself.
I wanted to go outside and get a breath of fresh air.
Why didn\'t Tom tell us that he was going to be late?
Tom doesn\'t have many pictures of himself as a baby.
I can\'t get married without my parents\' permission.
I can\'t study anywhere in my house. It\'s too noisy.
There\'s not enough space in my car for anybody else.
This is the first time I\'ve seen anything like this.
Tom and Mary aren\'t quite sure what to make of this.
Tom and Mary don\'t eat out as often as they used to.
Tom pretended that he didn\'t see what was happening.
Tom doesn\'t have to do anything he doesn\'t want to.
I\'ve come to warn you about what\'s going to happen.
How do you know that light travels faster than sound?
I ate about half of it and left the rest on my plate.
I began to be afraid you would never come back again.
Are you going to go to Tom\'s concert tomorrow night?
Did you know you are stronger than you think you are?
I like pinto beans, but I don\'t eat them very often.
